record_id.description: Record ID - Unique identifier for the medical record.
record_id.notes: Internal development use. K000s for K-patient (K in N).

p_hospital_id.description: Select your Hospital - Options: 2=Lausanne, 3=Geneva, 4=Vevey-Riviera Chablais, 5=Aigle-Riviera, 6=Sion, 7=Neuchatel, 8=Delemont, 9=Fribourg, 10=Biel_Bienne, 11=Berne FK, 12=Berne KISPI, 15=Basel, 16=Bruderholz, 17=Olten, 18=Aarau, 19=Baden, 20=Lucerne, 21=Bellinzona, 22=Mendrisio, 23=Locarno, 24=Lugano Civico, 25=Chur Kantonsspital, 26=Schaffhausen, 27=Zurich KISPI, 28=Zurich Triemli, 29=Zurich UniSpital, 30=Zollikerberg, 31=Winterthur, 32=Muensterlingen, 33=St. Gallen, 34=St. Gallen FK, 35=Meyrin Hôpital de la Tour, 36=Morges EHC, 37=Nyon, 38=Payerne, 39=Yverdon-les-Bains EHNV, 40=Uster, 41=Buelach, 42=Grangettes, 43=Lugano Sant' Anna, 44=Rennaz, 45=Solothurn, 70=Graz, 71=Salzburg, 72=Wien, 80=München, 81=Heidelberg, 82=Frankfurt, 83=Freiburg, 999=Other
p_hospital_id.notes: Sometimes the difference between Berne FK (Frauenspital Kinderklinik) and Berne KISPI (Kinderklinik / Children's Hospital Bern) is not present in the documentation provided. Our model outputs KISPI for P2 and P4 and validation data points FK. We should have more information about it.

p_hospital_id_other.description: Specify Other Hospital - Text field for hospital name when Hospital ID is 999 (Other)
p_hospital_id_other.notes: There's no "other hospital" case in the validation data. But it should work correctly if the name of the hospital is specified in the documentation provided to the system.

id_neonet.description: NeoNet ID - Patient identifier in NeoNet system (validation: number). Important: Sometimes called patient ID.
id_neonet.notes: We should know all the different ways to call this identifier in the documentation. Is it always called "Patient ID"?

p_date_of_birth.description: Date of birth - Patient's birth date in YYYY-MM-DD format (validation: date_dmy, must be before admission date)

p_year_of_birth.description: Year of birth - Four-digit year when patient was born (validation: number, range 2000-2050)

p_informed_consent.description: Informed consent given - Status of consent for data collection. Options: 1=Informed consent received, 2=Patient informed, 3=Anonymized data transfer, 4=General consent received, 5=child born prior to 2015, 6=informed consent status unknown at follow-up, 7=denied
p_informed_consent.notes: Not present in the documentation. We suggest introducing this variable manually.

p_informed_consent_date.description: Date of the informed consent given - Date when consent was obtained in YYYY-MM-DD format
p_informed_consent_date.notes: Not present in the documentation. We suggest introducing this variable manually.

p_informed_consent_file.description: Upload signed (informed) consent form here - File path or reference to consent document
p_informed_consent_file.notes: Not present in the documentation. We suggest introducing this variable manually.

p_birth_location.description: Birth location - Where the birth occurred. Options: 1=inborn, 2=outborn. Critical: Only babies born at the Geburtshilfe Inselspital in Bern are considered inborn. All others are considered outborn.

p_place_of_birth.description:
Specify the place of birth if the patient is outborn. Use the standardized name from the following list whenever possible:

Lausanne, Geneva, Vevey-Riviera Chablais, Aigle-Riviera, Sion, Neuchatel, Delemont, Fribourg, Biel_Bienne, Berne FK, Berne KISPI, Basel, Bruderholz, Olten, Aarau, Baden, Lucerne, Bellinzona, Mendrisio, Locarno, Lugano Civico, Chur Kantonsspital, Schaffhausen, Zurich KISPI, Zurich Triemli, Zurich UniSpital, Zollikerberg, Winterthur, Muensterlingen, St. Gallen, St. Gallen FK, Meyrin Hôpital de la Tour, Morges EHC, Nyon, Payerne, Yverdon-les-Bains EHNV, Uster, Buelach, Grangettes, Lugano Sant' Anna, Rennaz, Solothurn, Graz, Salzburg, Wien, München, Heidelberg, Frankfurt, Freiburg.

If the location is not on this list, write the name exactly as it appears in the documentation.
p_place_of_birth.notes: Some minor revision necessary to adjust the prompt. Standardize the way to call different hospitals (abbreviations).

p_date_of_admission.description: Date of admission - Date when patient was admitted in YYYY-MM-DD format (validation: date_dmy, must be after birth date)
p_date_of_admission.notes: It's not always specified in the documentation. Is there another way to say it? For patient 2, the validation data has a null and we get 2017-01-19 (the patient's date of birth).

p_ethnicity.notes: Not present in the documentation. We agreed to introduce this variable manually. Information about nationality can be extracted and presented in the UI for guidance.

p_ga_weeks.description: Weeks of gestation - Gestational age in completed weeks (validation: number, range 22-42)

p_ga_days.description: Days of gestation - Additional days beyond completed weeks (validation: number, range 0-6)
p_ga_days.notes: Works fine. We found an error for patient 2: the documentation is contradictory (entries 31 6/7 and 31 1/7 GW).

p_birth_weight.description: Birth weight in g - Weight at birth in grams (validation: number, range 200-5000)

m_length.description: Length at birth in cm - Body length at birth in centimeters (validation: number, range 15-60)
m_length.notes: Not always specified in the documentation provided. If specified, it works fine.

m_head_circ.description: Head circumference in cm - Occipitofrontal head circumference at birth in centimeters (validation: number, range 18-45)
m_head_circ.notes: Not always specified in the documentation provided. If specified, it works fine.

p_sex.description: Patient Sex - Gender assignment at birth. Options: 1=female, 2=male, 9=non-determinable

p_number_of_infants.description: Number of infants in this birth - Total number of babies born in this pregnancy (validation: number, range 1-7)

p_rank.description: Order of births - In which order was the child with NEC born? (first=A, second=B, etc.)
p_rank.notes: In patient 1 we found an error in the validation data that the model corrected. The correct value in this case is A (first twin) and not B (second twin), in contradiction with the (incorrect) validation data.

delivery.description: Delivery mode - Method of delivery. Options: 1=spontaneous, 2=assisted vaginal delivery, 3=cesarian section

m_chorioamnionitis.notes: All the validation data contains a 0 in this field. We didn't get any false positives, but we need more data to ensure the identification of positive cases.

m_mhypertension.description: Maternal hypertension - High blood pressure during pregnancy. Options: 0=no, 1=without edema and/or proteinuria, 2=with edema/proteinuria (preeclampsia, HELLP)
m_mhypertension.notes: We need more validation data to assess the stage of this variable.

m_intrauterin_infections.description: Maternal infections - Intrauterine infections during pregnancy. Critical: This refers exclusively to maternal infections, not neonatal or newborn infections. Options: 0=no, 1=yes suspected, 2=yes proven
m_intrauterin_infections.notes: Clarify the difference between suspected and proven. Not always clear in the documentation. Conservative aproach.

m_intrauterin_infections_specify.description: Specify Maternal infections - Detailed description of maternal infections if present
m_intrauterin_infections_specify.notes: We need more data to confirm. But it's the type of variable that should work fine.

m_ab_preg.description: Antibiotics given within 1 month before delivery - Options: 0=No, 1=Yes
m_ab_preg.notes: We need more data to assess the stage of this variable. It would be helpful to have a list of typical antibiotics given in this scenario.

m_ab_preg_desc.description: Description of Antibiotics given within 1 month before delivery - Details of antibiotic treatment (names, duration, indication, trimester, etc.)
m_ab_preg_desc.notes: We need more data to confirm. But it's the type of variable that should work fine.

m_prenatal_steroids.description: Prenatal steroids (Antenatal corticosteroids for fetal lung maturation) - Options: 0=no, 1=incomplete, 2=complete, 3=yes, but doses unknown
m_prenatal_steroids.notes: We need to adjust the definitions. Someone with domain specific knowledge would be helpful in order to understand the specific clinical scenarios that lead to the classification of 'incomplete', 'complete', or 'absent' steroid administration. There could be errors in the validation data, but we need a better understanding of the variable for confirmation. Two courses of antenatal steroids were started, but dosing details are missing. This supports Option 1 (Incomplete), Option 2 (Complete) if assuming full dosing, or Option 3 (Given, dose unknown). The validation chose 3 due to missing specifics; the model predicted 2, likely inferring completion.

m_ua_ph.description: Umbilical artery pH - pH value from umbilical artery blood gas (validation: number_2dp, range 6.50-7.90)
m_ua_ph.notes: We found an error in the validation dataset. The umbilical artery pH was classified as UNK for patient 3, although it was actually known. In fact, the patient was diagnosed with perinatal acidosis (pH 7.05). Additionally, patient 4 in the validation dataset is supposed to have a pH of 7.32, but we found no information about this value in the documents related to patient 4, probably because the information is missing from our records.

m_apgar1.description: Apgar 1 min - Apgar score at 1 minute after birth (validation: number, range 0-10)

m_apgar5.description: Apgar 5 min - Apgar score at 5 minutes after birth (validation: number, range 0-10)

m_apgar10.description: Apgar 10 min - Apgar score at 10 minutes after birth (validation: number, range 0-10)

m_bdefect.description: Congenital malformation - Presence of birth defects. Options: 0=No, 1=Yes
m_bdefect.notes: ERRORS - due to PDA. Needs revision.

m_bdefect_specify___1.description: Congenital malformation - ASD (Atrial Septal Defect). Binary indicator for ASD presence. If not mentioned, consider absent - Options: 0=Absent, 1=Present

m_bdefect_specify___2.description: Congenital malformation - VSD (Ventricular Septal Defect). Binary indicator for VSD presence. If not mentioned, consider absent - Options: 0=Absent, 1=Present

m_bdefect_specify___88.description: Congenital malformation - Other anomalies. Binary indicator for other anomalies presence. If not mentioned, consider absent - Options: 0=Absent, 1=Present

m_bdefect_specify___unk.description: Congenital malformation - Unknown type. Binary indicator for unknown congenital malformation type - Options: 0=Not unknown, 1=Unknown type

m_bdefect_specify___na.description: Congenital malformation - Not applicable. Binary indicator for when congenital malformation specification is not applicable - Options: 0=Applicable, 1=Not applicable

m_bdefect_other_specify.description: Specify other congenital malformation - Text field for other malformations not listed
m_bdefect_other_specify.notes: We need more data to assess the stage of this variable.

m_pda.notes: The variable works as expected. However, we recommend changing the coding from 1 = absent and 2 = present to the more conventional 0 = absent and 1 = present. Unless there is a specific reason for the current coding scheme, we suggest aligning with standard practice. If such a reason exists, please let us know.

m_medication_pda___0.description: PDA management approach - Conservative/no intervention. Indicates PDA was managed without pharmacological or surgical treatment. If not mentioned, consider (?) - Options: 0=False (active treatment given), 1=True (conservative management)
m_medication_pda___0.notes: We need more data to assess the stage of this variable.

m_medication_pda___1.description: PDA pharmacological closure - Ibuprofen therapy. Indicates whether ibuprofen was administered for PDA closure attempt. If not mentioned, consider false - Options: 0=False (not administered), 1=True (administered)
m_medication_pda___1.notes: We need more data to assess the stage of this variable.

m_medication_pda___2.description: PDA pharmacological closure - Indomethacin therapy. Indicates whether indomethacin was administered for PDA closure attempt. If not mentioned, consider false - Options: 0=False (not administered), 1=True (administered)
m_medication_pda___2.notes: We need more data to assess the stage of this variable.

m_medication_pda___3.description: PDA combination pharmacological therapy. Indicates whether multiple medications were used for PDA closure (e.g., both ibuprofen and indomethacin). If not mentioned, consider false - Options: 0=False (single or no medication), 1=True (combination therapy)
m_medication_pda___3.notes: We recommend eliminating the variable ‘3 = both’.

m_medication_pda___4.description: PDA surgical intervention. Indicates whether surgical closure was performed (e.g., ligation, transcatheter device closure). If not mentioned, consider false - Options: 0=False (no surgery), 1=True (surgical intervention)
m_medication_pda___4.notes: We need more data to assess the stage of this variable.

m_medication_pda___5.description: PDA pharmacological closure - Paracetamol therapy. Indicates whether paracetamol (acetaminophen) was administered for PDA closure attempt. If not mentioned, consider false - Options: 0=False (not administered), 1=True (administered)
m_medication_pda___5.notes: We need more data to assess the stage of this variable.

m_medication_pda___6.description: PDA alternative therapeutic approach. Indicates whether other treatment modalities not otherwise specified were used for PDA management. If not mentioned, consider false - Options: 0=False (standard approach), 1=True (alternative therapy)
m_medication_pda___6.notes: We need more data to assess the stage of this variable.

m_medication_pda___unk.description: PDA treatment approach - Unknown/unspecified. Indicates whether the type of PDA treatment administered is unknown or not documented. If not mentioned, consider false - Options: 0=False (treatment type known), 1=True (treatment type unknown)
m_medication_pda___unk.notes: We recommend eliminating the variables "both" and "N/A". Maybe even "UNK" could be eliminated and just leave "null". We would like to discuss the meaning and the value of that variable "UNK", what's the difference between that field and just "null"?

m_medication_pda___na.description: PDA treatment assessment - Not applicable. Indicates whether PDA treatment evaluation/decision is not applicable to this patient. If not mentioned, consider true - Options: 0=False (treatment decision applicable), 1=True (treatment decision not applicable)
m_medication_pda___na.notes: We recommend eliminating the variables "both" and "N/A". Maybe even "UNK" could be eliminated and just leave "null". We would like to discuss the meaning and the value of that variable "UNK", what's the difference between that field and just "null"?

m_pda_surg_date.description: Date of surgical PDA ligation - Date when PDA surgery was performed in YYYY-MM-DD format
m_pda_surg_date.notes: We need more data to assess the stage of this variable.

m_surgery_pda_ligation_dol.description: Age (in Days) of surgical PDA ligation - Calculated field based on birth date and surgery date
m_surgery_pda_ligation_dol.notes: We need more data to assess the stage of this variable.

m_ino.description: Inhaled nitric oxide - Treatment with inhaled nitric oxide. Options: 0=No, 1=Yes
m_ino.notes: Our model identified an error in the validation data. There is evidence of patient 2 receiving iNO treatment along with O2 (typical use) on January 29, 2017, as documented in the intensive care records. This indicates inhaled nitric oxide therapy was administered, which contradicts the validation dataset classification for this patient.

m_probiotics_b_nec_onset.description: Probiotics before NEC onset - Administration of probiotics before NEC development. CRITICAL: The administration must be strictly before NEC onset. Options: 0=No, 1=Yes
m_probiotics_b_nec_onset.notes: The validation labels indicate '0' (no probiotics before NEC onset) for Patient 1 and '1' (probiotics administered before NEC onset) for Patients 2, 3, and 4. However, our model consistently predicts '0' for all patients, suggesting potential issues within the validation data. For Patients 2 and 4, the probiotic identified is 'BEBA HA,' subsequently recorded in the field 'm_probiotics_product.' Yet, documentation related to 'BEBA HA' appears only after NEC onset (for both patients), indicating possible misclassification. The only relevant entry before NEC onset for Patient 2 is 'Gut priming 8x0.5 ml.' We need clarification on whether this protocol includes probiotics or if this is a data entry error. Patient 3's validation entry mentions 'defenses', which also requires further verification. It would be helpful to receive a descriptive paragraph per probiotic detailing its typical representation in clinical documents, and confirmation if protocols like 'gut priming' inherently include any probiotics.

m_probiotics_product___1.description: Probiotic therapy - Probactiol administration. Indicates whether Probactiol probiotic product was administered before NEC onset. CRITICAL: The administration must be strictly before NEC onset. If not mentioned, consider false - Options: 0=False (not administered), 1=True (administered)
m_probiotics_product___1.notes: Probiotic product identification and timing relative to NEC onset requires careful documentation review.

m_probiotics_product___2.description: Probiotic therapy - Lactobacillus reuteri product. Indicates whether Lactobacillus reuteri containing products (e.g., BEBA HA Pre) were administered before NEC onset. CRITICAL: The administration must be strictly before NEC onset. If not mentioned, consider false - Options: 0=False (not administered), 1=True (administered)
m_probiotics_product___2.notes: We need more data to assess the stage of this variable.

CRITICAL: The administration must be strictly before NEC onset. If not mentioned, consider false - Options: 0=False (not administered), 1=True (administered)
m_probiotics_product___3.notes: We need more data to assess the stage of this variable.

CRITICAL: The administration must be strictly before NEC onset. If not mentioned, consider false - Options: 0=False (not administered), 1=True (administered)
m_probiotics_product___4.notes: We need more data to assess the stage of this variable.

CRITICAL: The administration must be strictly before NEC onset. If not mentioned, consider false - Options: 0=False (not administered), 1=True (administered)
m_probiotics_product___5.notes: We need more data to assess the stage of this variable.

m_probiotics_product___6.description: Probiotic therapy - Defenses administration. Indicates whether Defenses probiotic product was administered before NEC onset. CRITICAL: The administration must be strictly before NEC onset. If not mentioned, consider false - Options: 0=False (not administered), 1=True (administered)
m_probiotics_product___6.notes: We need more data to assess the stage of this variable.

m_probiotics_product___8.description: Probiotic therapy - Other products. Indicates whether other probiotic products not otherwise specified were administered before NEC onset. CRITICAL: The administration must be strictly before NEC onset. If not mentioned, consider false - Options: 0=False (not administered), 1=True (administered)
m_probiotics_product___8.notes: We need more data to assess the stage of this variable.

m_probiotics_product___unk.description: Probiotic therapy - Unknown product type. Indicates whether probiotic product type administered before NEC onset is unknown or not documented. CRITICAL: The administration must be strictly before NEC onset. If not mentioned, consider false - Options: 0=False (product type known / no product), 1=True (product type unknown)
m_probiotics_product___unk.notes: We need more data to assess the stage of this variable.

m_probiotics_product___na.description: Probiotic therapy assessment - Not applicable. Indicates whether probiotic administration assessment is not applicable for this patient. If not mentioned, consider false - Options: 0=False (assessment applicable), 1=True (assessment not applicable)
m_probiotics_product___na.notes: We need more data to assess the stage of this variable.

m_probiotics_product_other.description: Specify other probiotics given - Text field for other probiotic products not listed
m_probiotics_product_other.notes: We need more data to assess the stage of this variable.

m_ab_first24h.description: Antibiotics in first 24h - Whether antibiotics were given in the first 24 hours of life. Options: 0=No, 1=Yes
m_ab_first24h.notes: Works as expected. For patient 3, the validation dataset shows '1' while we have 'null'. Our available documentation corresponds to a later respiratory infection episode, not to the neonatal period. Confirming antibiotic use within the first 24 hours of life would require access to neonatal ICU records, immediate postnatal clinical notes, or birth medication records. Since this information was not available in our data sources, the 'null' value is appropriate. The discrepancy may be due to an error in the validation dataset or access to additional documentation on their end.

ab_before.description: Administration of antibiotics before NEC onset. Options: 0=No, 1=Yes. Critical: The administration of antibiotics must strictly occur before the diagnosis of NEC (Grade IIa) to be marked as 1 = Yes; antibiotics administered on the same day as NEC onset do not qualify as 'before'.
ab_before.notes:
Errors CORRECTED with critical field anañysis - 100% correct

Patients 1 and 4 are correct and consistent. For Patient 3, the same issue persists as previously noted in 'ab_before_days' due to missing information about antibiotic administration prior to NEC. IMPORTANT: For Patient 2, antibiotics (co-amoxicillin and amikacin) started exactly on January 25, coinciding with NEC Grade IIa diagnosis, meaning our previous value of '1' was incorrect; it should be '0' because antibiotics administered on the same day as NEC onset do not qualify as 'before.' This has been corrected in the prompt to prevent this error.

ab_before_days.description: Days of (any) antibiotics before NEC onset - Total days of antibiotic treatment before NEC (validation: number, range 0-120)
ab_before_days.notes: Discrepancies were due to whether the start day of antibiotics was counted as day 0 or day 1. Our review of clinical reports confirmed that the system likely treated the start day as day 0. Additionally, NEC onset day is excluded from the count. This is and has to be clearly stated in the variable definition to avoid ambiguity. Example - Patient 1: Antibiotics started on January 13 and ended on January 17, with NEC onset on January 19. The correct 'ab_before_days' is 5 (counting Jan 13 as Day 1 and Jan 17 as Day 5). The validation data reported 4, suggesting that the start day was treated as Day 0. Example - Patient 3: Two antibiotic courses were given — first from Day 1 to Day 5, and then from Day 10 to Day 12, with NEC onset on Day 13. The correct 'ab_before_days' should be 8 (5 + 3). The validation data reported 5, likely due to only the first antibiotic course being captured or an error in summing multiple courses. Example - Patient 4: Antibiotics were administered from March 9 to March 15, with NEC onset on March 19. Here, the validation correctly reported 'ab_before_days' as 7, aligning with the rule that the start day counts as Day 1 and the NEC day is excluded. This highlights the importance of ensuring two things: (1) consistent counting conventions (start day = Day 1, NEC day excluded), and (2) proper summation of all antibiotic periods prior to NEC onset, even when non-consecutive.

m_ab_ttt_nr.description: Number of periods of Antibiotic Treatment before NEC - Count of distinct antibiotic treatment episodes (validation: number, range 0-5)
m_ab_ttt_nr.notes: One discrepancy identified for patient 3, where validation indicates 2 antibiotic treatment periods before NEC but 0 was registered. The discrepancy may be due to the short amount of data we have for patient 3. Patients 1, 2, and 4 matched correctly without issues.

m_sepsis___1.description: Sepsis status - Absent. Indicates no clinical evidence of sepsis or meningitis during hospitalization. If not mentioned, consider true - Options: 0=False (sepsis present), 1=True (sepsis absent)
m_sepsis___1.notes: It’s working correctly overall. Patient 3 is absent in our model and absent + culture-negative in validation data, which points to a potential mistake in the validation data (does that make sense? - missing information). CRITICAL: Patient 4 is labelled absent in the validation data while it has negative-cultures (that were correctly detected by the used model).

m_sepsis___2.description: Sepsis type - Culture-negative. Indicates clinical sepsis with negative blood/CSF cultures but meeting clinical criteria for sepsis or meningitis. If not mentioned, consider false - Options: 0=False (not culture-negative sepsis), 1=True (culture-negative sepsis)
m_sepsis___2.notes: We need more data to assess the stage of this variable.

m_sepsis___3.description: Sepsis type - Culture-proven. Indicates confirmed sepsis or meningitis with positive blood cultures, CSF cultures, or other microbiological evidence. If not mentioned, consider false - Options: 0=False (not culture-proven sepsis), 1=True (culture-proven sepsis)
m_sepsis___3.notes: We need more data to assess the stage of this variable.

m_sepsis___unk.description: Sepsis assessment - Unknown type. Indicates sepsis suspected but type/confirmation status unknown or insufficiently documented. If not mentioned, consider false - Options: 0=False (sepsis type known), 1=True (sepsis type unknown)
m_sepsis___unk.notes: We need more data to assess the stage of this variable.

m_sepsis___na.description: Sepsis evaluation - Not applicable. Indicates sepsis assessment not applicable for this patient's clinical situation. If not mentioned, consider false - Options: 0=False (sepsis assessment applicable), 1=True (sepsis assessment not applicable)
m_sepsis___na.notes: We need more data to assess the stage of this variable.

m_sepsis_cul_neg_post.description: Provide number of negative cultures after NEC onset - Count of negative cultures (validation: number, range 0-5)
m_sepsis_cul_neg_post.notes: The validation data for patient 1 likely includes negative cultures that occurred before the onset of NEC, which contradicts the field’s intended definition.

m_sepsis_episodes_post.description: If Proven, provide number of episodes after NEC onset - Count of sepsis episodes (validation: number, range 0-5)
m_sepsis_episodes_post.notes: Couldn’t test this field yet as we didn’t get a proven culture output.

m_sepsis_com.description: Comment on all Periods of Sepsis (incl. Meningitis) during hospitalization - Free text field for sepsis findings
m_sepsis_com.notes: Great improvement. Offers grat interpretability of the reasoning behind the other sepsis veriables. Really great performance.

m_surfactant.description: Surfactant treatment - Administration of lung surfactant. Options: 1=not given, 2=given. Critical: exogenous surfactant administration must be explicitly mentioned in the documentation.
m_surfactant.notes:
CORRECTED with critical fields analysis - 100% acuracy


CRITICAL: The clinical note for Patient 2 describes respiratory distress syndrome due to primary surfactant deficiency in a premature infant, with CPAP support and oxygen supplementation. These findings could suggest that surfactant treatment was clinically indicated, but it wasn’t. We should adjust the PROMPT. For patient 3, again, we probably are lacking some reports as it points a null in our output (because it’s not mentioned in our given documents) and the validation data indicates an administration of lung surfactant. We recommend changing the coding from 1 = not given and 2 = given to the more conventional 0 = not given and 1 = given. Unless there is a specific reason for the current coding scheme, we suggest aligning with standard practice. If such a reason exists, please let us know.

enteral_start.description: Enteral feeding before NEC onset: start day - Day when enteral feeding started (validation: number, range 1-7, where 1=1st day after birth). When identifying the start of enteral feeding, pay close attention to any mention of nutrition administered p.o. (by mouth) or via tube (such as nasogastric or orogastric tube). These routes indicate enteral nutrition, as opposed to parenteral nutrition (which is given i.v.).
enteral_start.notes: NOT WORKING. Prompt adjusted - look for improvement. Seems to work better now.

m_enteral_pre___0.description: Enteral feeding status - No feeding. Indicates absence of enteral feeding before NEC onset (patient remained NPO or received only parenteral nutrition). If not mentioned, consider false - Options: 0=False (enteral feeding given), 1=True (no enteral feeding)
m_enteral_pre___0.notes:
When the 'MM plus formula' category is given, what should be the values assigned to the 'MM only' (1) and 'formula only' (7) categories? We interpret that they should be 0, as they indicate exclusivity ('only MM' / 'only formula'). However, would it be more appropriate to remove the combined category ('MM plus formula') and instead express the information through combinations of the other variables?.

ERROR

m_enteral_pre___1.description: Enteral feeding type - Exclusive mother's milk (MM). Indicates patient received only mother's own milk before NEC onset, without supplements or formula. CRITICAL: The feeding must be strictly before NEC onset. If not mentioned, consider false - Options: 0=False (not exclusive MM), 1=True (exclusive MM)
m_enteral_pre___1.notes: We need more data to assess the stage of this variable.

m_enteral_pre___2.description: Enteral feeding type - Mother's milk plus formula combination. Indicates patient received mother's own milk supplemented with infant formula before NEC onset. CRITICAL: The feeding must be strictly before NEC onset. If not mentioned, consider false - Options: 0=False (not MM+formula), 1=True (MM+formula combination)
m_enteral_pre___2.notes: We need more data to assess the stage of this variable.

m_enteral_pre___3.description: Enteral feeding type - Mother's milk plus fortified milk supplement (FMS). Indicates patient received mother's own milk with human milk fortifiers or specialized supplements before NEC onset. CRITICAL: The feeding must be strictly before NEC onset. If not mentioned, consider false - Options: 0=False (not MM+FMS), 1=True (MM+FMS combination)
m_enteral_pre___3.notes: We need more data to assess the stage of this variable.

m_enteral_pre___4.description: Enteral feeding type - Donor human milk (non-maternal). Indicates patient received human milk from donors other than the mother before NEC onset. CRITICAL: The feeding must be strictly before NEC onset. If not mentioned, consider false - Options: 0=False (not donor milk), 1=True (donor human milk)
m_enteral_pre___4.notes: We need more data to assess the stage of this variable.

m_enteral_pre___5.description: Enteral feeding type - Donor human milk plus formula. Indicates patient received donor human milk supplemented with infant formula before NEC onset. CRITICAL: The feeding must be strictly before NEC onset. If not mentioned, consider false - Options: 0=False (not donor milk+formula), 1=True (donor milk+formula)
m_enteral_pre___5.notes: We need more data to assess the stage of this variable.

m_enteral_pre___6.description: Enteral feeding type - Donor human milk plus FMS. Indicates patient received donor human milk with fortified milk supplements before NEC onset. CRITICAL: The feeding must be strictly before NEC onset. If not mentioned, consider false - Options: 0=False (not donor milk+FMS), 1=True (donor milk+FMS)
m_enteral_pre___6.notes: We need more data to assess the stage of this variable.

m_enteral_pre___7.description: Enteral feeding type - Exclusive infant formula. Indicates patient received only commercial infant formula without human milk before NEC onset. CRITICAL: The feeding must be strictly before NEC onset. If not mentioned, consider false - Options: 0=False (not exclusive formula), 1=True (exclusive formula)
m_enteral_pre___7.notes: We need more data to assess the stage of this variable.

m_enteral_pre___8.description: Enteral feeding type - Other feeding products. Indicates patient received alternative enteral nutrition products not otherwise categorized. CRITICAL: The feeding must be strictly before NEC onset. If not mentioned, consider false - Options: 0=False (not other products), 1=True (other feeding products)
m_enteral_pre___8.notes: We need more data to assess the stage of this variable.

m_enteral_pre___9.description: Enteral feeding status - Feeding confirmed, product unknown. Indicates enteral feeding was documented before NEC onset but specific product type is not identified. CRITICAL: The feeding must be strictly before NEC onset. Options: 0=False (product known or no feeding), 1=True (feeding confirmed, product unknown)
m_enteral_pre___9.notes: We need more data to assess the stage of this variable.

m_enteral_pre___unk.description: Enteral feeding assessment - Unknown type. Indicates whether enteral feeding type before NEC onset is unknown or insufficiently documented. Options: 0=False (feeding type known), 1=True (feeding type unknown)
m_enteral_pre___unk.notes: We need more data to assess the stage of this variable.

m_enteral_pre___na.description: Enteral feeding evaluation - Not applicable. Indicates whether enteral feeding assessment is not applicable for this patient's clinical situation. Options: 0=False (assessment applicable), 1=True (assessment not applicable)
m_enteral_pre___na.notes: We need more data to assess the stage of this variable.

m_enteral_pre_other.description: Specify other enteral feeding - Text field for other feeding types not listed
m_enteral_pre_other.notes: We need more data to assess the stage of this variable.

m_surgery_cardiac.description: Cardiac surgery - Surgical intervention on the heart. Options: 0=none/minor, 1=yes
m_surgery_cardiac.notes: It works as expected, but we need more data to confirm. All the validation data currently has 0s in this field.

m_surgery_cardiac_specific.description: Specify cardiac surgery - Detailed description of cardiac surgical procedure performed
m_surgery_cardiac_specific.notes: We need more data to assess the stage of this variable.

m_nec.description: Necrotising enterocolitis - NEC diagnosis status. Options: 1=no, 2=suspected, 3=yes
m_nec.notes: We propose updating the option values to 0 = No, 1 = Yes, and 2 = Suspected to improve clarity and align with standard coding practices. Otherwise, the feature is working as expected, labeling all patients in the validation dataset as 'Yes'.

uncertainties_nec.description: Are there any uncertainties with the classification of NEC? - Options: 0=No, 1=Yes
uncertainties_nec.notes: Why is this field left blank in the validation data? When is it applicable? Our model is currently populating it with 0s, as no uncertainty has been identified.

m_nec_onset_date.description: Date of (Proven) NEC Diagnosis - Date when NEC was definitively diagnosed in YYYY-MM-DD format
m_nec_onset_date.notes: Functioning as expected. For patient 3, the documentation specifies the month but not the exact day.

m_nec_treatment.description: Treatment for NEC - Type of treatment provided for NEC. Options: 0=none, 1=medical only/conservative, 2=medical and surgical
m_nec_treatment.notes: Functioning as expected for all patients.

m_nec_onset.description: Age (Days) when proven NEC (Bell's stage 2) diagnosed - Calculated field based on birth date and NEC onset date
m_nec_onset.notes: Functioning as expected. Patient 1 is 7, not 6.

radio_ileus.description: Radiological diagnosis of ileus within first 48h after NEC onset - Options: 0=No, 1=Yes
radio_ileus.notes: There may be a potential discrepancy worth reviewing. For patient 1, the documentation explicitly states: 'Radiologically showed pneumatosis intestinalis et hepatis with static small bowel loops' on January 19, 2025 (NEC onset day), which is classic radiological evidence of ileus. This finding occurred within the required 48-hour timeframe. 'Static small bowel loops' is a recognized radiological sign of ileus, indicating disrupted intestinal peristalsis and functional obstruction. The clinical evidence strongly supports coding this as 1 (Yes); however, the validation data labels this variable as 0 (No).

intubation_after.description: Intubation after NEC onset - Options: 0=no, 1=yes: continuation, 2=yes: new intubation, 3=yes: intubation due to surgery
intubation_after.notes:
Resultats inconsistents en pacient 2, dona 2 i 3 alternativament. Hauriem d'ajustar el prompt per tal de que tingui en compte cirugia.
Pel patient 3, el cas com sempre és que falta info.

pen_after.description: PEN (parenteral nutrition) after NEC onset - Options: 0=no, 1=yes: continuation of PEN, 2=yes: new PEN treatment after NEC onset, 3=yes, without further information

options.2: yes: new PEN treatment after NEC onset

pen_after.notes: Aquest potser l'haurem de revisar amb més itineràncies, al P3 li falta data, el P1, P2 i P3 no els fa bé (o si però varia indistintament entre respostes correctes i incorrectes). Hauriem de posar-ho (que no sé si ja hi és) en un critical field i veure com reacciona.

npo_overall.description: Non per os (nothing by mouth) overall - Options: 0=No, 1=Yes
npo_overall.notes: Works as expected. Improvement made for P4: the validation data was previously pointing to null, but it was actually a positive case.

npo_duration.description: Non per os duration overall in days - Duration of NPO status (validation: number, range 0-30)

perf_date.description: Date of complication: Perforation - Date when perforation occurred in YYYY-MM-DD format

m_feeding_full_date.notes: Question: Before Nec onset or after NEC onset? What does it mean exactly 'full feed'? Does it mean just enteral or strictly oral?

m_feeding_full.description: Age at 'First day of life full feed reached' - Calculated field based on birth date and full feeding date
m_feeding_full.notes: Question: Before Nec onset or after NEC onset? What does it mean exactly 'full feed'? Does it mean just enteral or strictly oral?

m_surg1_reason___1.description: Reason for 1st surgery - Fast-progression. Options: 0=False (not fast-progression), 1=True (fast-progression)

m_surg1_reason___2.description: Reason for 1st surgery - Passage problem/obstruction. Options: 0=False (not passage problem/obstruction), 1=True (passage problem/obstruction)

histo1_pathono.description: Histologic specimen 1: ID-Number of pathology report - Pathology report identifier
histo1_pathono.notes: Works as expected. Missing data in patient 3.

histo1_date.description: Histologic specimen 1 date - Date of histological examination in YYYY-MM-DD format
histo1_date.notes: Wrong date for patient 1 corrected - 2025-01-21. Missing data for patients 2 and 3.

histo1_result.description: Findings histologic specimen 1 - Detailed histological findings
histo1_result.notes: Improved findings for patient 1: Small bowel resection: Transmural florid necrotizing enterocolitis. No malignancy.

m_nec_surgery2_date.description: Date of 2nd NEC surgery - Date when second NEC surgery was performed in YYYY-MM-DD format

m_nec_surgery3_date.description: Date of 3rd NEC surgery - Date when third NEC surgery was performed in YYYY-MM-DD format
m_nec_surgery3_date.notes:
Error in validation data. Missing surgery 3 for patient 2.
The ileostomy reversal surgery performed on June 1, 2017 is documented in Document 9 ("StomaVerschluss nach 6 Monaten AB.rtf") from the discharge report dated June 15, 2017. This was the planned reversal of the loop ileostomy that had been created on February 15, 2017. The procedure was uncomplicated and included intraoperative central venous catheter (CVC) insertion by anesthesia. The patient required postoperative monitoring for one night in the intensive care unit, followed by uncomplicated extubation and hemodynamic stability without need for catecholamine support. The patient was transferred back to the pediatric surgical ward on June 2, 2017, in good general condition. The hospitalization lasted from May 31 to June 7, 2017, with progressive dietary buildup and satisfactory wound healing. If this surgery information is missing from your validation data, it represents a significant gap since this was a major surgical procedure that completed the patient's surgical treatment sequence for necrotizing enterocolitis complications.

m_nec_surgery4_date.description: Date of 4th NEC surgery - Date when fourth NEC surgery was performed in YYYY-MM-DD format
m_nec_surgery4_date.notes: Works as expected. Missing data for patient 3.

m_nec_surgery5_date.description: Date of 5th NEC surgery - Date when fifth NEC surgery was performed in YYYY-MM-DD format
m_nec_surgery5_date.notes: No patitent with 5 surgeries in the validation data.

m_re_nec_1.description: RE-NEC or Re-FIP (defined as recurrence of NEC when child is fully enteral nourished/PEN stopped) - Options: 0=no, 1=yes, 99=not documented

m_dx_date2.description: 2nd NEC: Date at Diagnosis (start NPO) - Date when second NEC episode was diagnosed in YYYY-MM-DD format

m_age_at_diagnosis2.description: 2nd NEC: Age at diagnoses - Calculated field based on birth date and second NEC diagnosis date

m_bell.description: Bell staging (max documented grade) - always report worst documented grading during disease. Options: 20=stage 1, 21=stage 2a, 22=stage 2b, 31=stage 3a, 32=stage 3b, NA=not applicable, UNK=unknown
m_bell.notes: Works as expected. Ambiguity in patient 1 between 31 and 32. Under broader or more modern criteria, most clinicians would classify this case as Stage 3b (32) but if following a strict radiologic/perforation-based definition, you could justify Stage 3a (31) due to absence of documented perforation, presence of transmural necrosis and severe systemic illness.

p_died.description: Child died at any time - Mortality status. Options: 0=No, 1=Yes

age_at_death.notes: Works as expected. Default value correction.

m_died_duetonec.notes: Works as expected. Sometimes unclear for patient 1 (2/24). All answers (0, 1, 2) can be justified depending on whether the focus is on the immediate cause (respiratory failure), underlying condition (NEC), or a multifactorial process. We need more information.
